unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Gets a Boost**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Gets a Boost

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – A new wave of AI-powered inventory forecasting solutions is sweeping across the Indian manufacturing sector, promising to optimize supply chains and reduce waste. Companies are leveraging these tools to predict demand more accurately, particularly crucial during peak seasons like Diwali and ahead of major sporting events.
normalised: Mumbai, India – A new wave of A I-powered inventory forecasting solutions is sweeping across the Indian manufacturing sector, promising to optimize supply chains and reduce waste. Companies are leveraging these tools to predict demand more accurately, particularly crucial during peak seasons like Diwali and ahead of major sporting events.

unnormalised: "Traditional methods often fall short, especially when dealing with the complexities of the Indian market," explains Dr. Priya Sharma, head of analytics at IIT Delhi, who recently published a study on the efficacy of machine learning in inventory management. "Our research shows that AI can significantly improve forecast accuracy, leading to better stock levels and reduced storage costs."

unnormalised: Several manufacturers, from textile mills in Surat to automotive component suppliers in Chennai, report substantial improvements. One FMCG company producing popular biryani spices saw a 15% reduction in inventory holding costs after implementing a new forecasting system. This optimization is expected to be a game-changer in the competitive Indian market, where even a slight edge can make a significant difference. Experts predict widespread adoption within the next 12-18 months.
